decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Block Plan; D&A Statement; Devas8/Existingplans; Devas8/ExistingproposedNEElevation; Photos; Devas8/Proposedplans; Devas8/Existingproposedrearelevation; Devas8/Existingproposedroofplan; Devas8/Existingproposedfrontsection; Devas8/Existingproposedsidesection; Devas8/LocationPlan; Devas8/Existingproposedstreetelevation; Devas8/ExistingproposedSWElevation

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no window, door or other opening other than those expressly authorised by this permission shall be constructed without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the dormer windows at roof level in the NE and SW elevation shall be glazed with obscure glass and fixed shut to a height of 1.7m above internal finished floor level and shall be permanently maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 6 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with pre-application advice.
   ii) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   iii) The application was approved without delay.
   iv) The application was considered by the Planning Committee where the applicant/agent had the opportunity to speak to the committee and promote the application.
description: DEMOLITION OF EXISTING GARAGE TO BE REPLACED BY TWO STOREY EXTENSION AND REAR ROOF EXTENSIONS. ERECTION OF GROUND FLOOR SIDE AND REAR EXTENSIONS.
